results.title: Video expeditions collection
results.brief_description: This series of travel documentaries is sure to delight. They engage even the most dedicated armchair traveller on a series of adventures guaranteed to create itchy feet and a desire to pack and head for the nearest travel agent.

results.title: Video and Animation Workshops 2006
results.brief_description: A selection of video and animated works created by young students from different schools in various ACMI Workshops during 2006, including “Scratch it”, “Digital Poetry”, and “Claymation”. Also includes two untitled abstract animated works.

results.title: Video 50
results.creator_credit: Robert Boner, Caroline Arrighi, Robert Wilson and Film and Video Collectif and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen (ZDF)
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Video 50 is an extraordinary video sketchbook, a highly original, visually dramatic and frequently humorous collection of one hundred abbreviated ‘episodes’ produced for television. Unfolding as a series of thirty-second vignettes, this enigmatic essay in style is characterized by a deadpan theatricality, symbolist imagery, surrealist juxtapositions and repetition of key visual motifs. Indelible images, precisely composed — a man teetering above a waterfall, a floating chair, a winking eye, a parrot against the New York skyline — are accompanied by an ‘architectural’ sound score that includes spoken ‘phonetic patterns’ rather than words. Fusing his surprising visual logic and rhythms with unexpected temporal manipulations, Wilson creates a work of startling wit and poetry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Boner, Caroline Arrighi, Robert Wilson and Film and Video Collectif and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen (ZDF)

results.title: Victory over polio
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
The history of polio and its treatment and the discovery of the Salk vaccine. Old newsreels show the late President Roosevelt in the early stages of treatment at the Georgia Retreat, and Sister Kenny at work. Some of the medical men who have worked on the disease and the final triumph by Dr. Jonas E. Salk.

results.title: Victory in the West = Sieg im Westen
results.brief_description: The official German army film, covering its campaigns in Belgium, Holland and France in May and June of 1940. An army film on the conquest of the Low Countries and France, using authentic material. The campaign is explained in detail with maps. Silent film.

results.title: Victorian vintage
results.brief_description: Dr. W.S. Benwell, a wine specialist, takes the viewer on a conducted tour of the wine growing areas of Victoria. Includes Yeringberg, an old vineyard which has been re-established near Melbourne, Bailey’s vineyard and the Rutherglen Wine Festival, the Swan Hill area, Chateau Tahbilk, the Grampians area of Western Victoria (Great Western Champagne country) and back to Melbourne.

results.title: Victorian Tapestry Workshop
results.creator_credit: Ivan Hexter, Victorian Film Corporation and Paul Jansen
results.brief_description: The Victorian Tapestry Workshop was established in 1976 with State Government assistance. This film shows the efforts of the workshop in transforming a Roger Kemp painting into a major tapestry.
